summary: This document is email correspondence between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding upcoming court appearances in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses an arraignment scheduled for April 23, 2021, and a bail appeal oral argument scheduled for April 26, 2021.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of emails from prosecutors regarding scheduling and attendance for court appearances in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Appears as a recipient of emails from prosecutors regarding scheduling and attendance for court appearances in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, subject of the scheduling discussions regarding her arraignment and bail appeal.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: Scheduled an in-person arraignment for Ghislaine Maxwell on April 23, 2021, at 500 Pearl Street.

connections.description: Both are defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated by their shared receipt of scheduling emails from prosecutors.
Brad Edwards is a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated in the email correspondence about her case.
Brittany Henderson is a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, as indicated in the email correspondence about her case.
Judge Nathan is presiding over the arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arraignment of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An in-person arraignment scheduled by Judge Nathan for Ghislaine Maxwell at 2:30 p.m. in courtroom 24B at 500 Pearl Street.

events.title: Bail Appeal Oral Argument
events.description: The Second Circuit scheduled a remote oral argument in connection with Ghislaine Maxwell's bail appeal at 10 a.m., to be livestreamed.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment was scheduled for April 23, 2021, at 500 Pearl Street.
A bail appeal oral argument for Ghislaine Maxwell was scheduled for April 26, 2021, by the Second Circuit.
The correspondence involves Assistant United States Attorneys from the Southern District of New York communicating with defense attorneys Brad Edwards and Brittany Henderson.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings in United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell in April 2021.
